Swain is not a counter to Zed early, but is during the late. Unfortunately early game, Zed can outpush him, and Swain will have a hard time farming. And he can't afford to rush Zhonya, Rod of Ages is absolutely necessary for Swain to allow him to scale into the game.

Skin comment aside, because thats the skin teams job, the reason they've "forgotten" Swain was because he was in a perfectly fine state before. They didn't see any reason to buff/nerf him. But now, Swain synergizes well with the new masteries.

Thunderlord Decree works fine, due to the majority of his click and point damage. Stormraiders Surge give Swain more sticking power without the of slows. Meditation (or w/e the mana regen mastery is) helps Swain sustain through lanes, while also having available the option for small amount of spellvamp and lifesteal. 

Plus SV got buffed with its MR making it an even better choice agaisnt vs mage lanes.

actually, none of those masteries have anything to do with swain's decided nerfs

Deathfire Touch mastery applies X + 20% of ap as a 3 second DoT and half in half the time for AOE and DoT spells

i'm not sure of the actual mis-coding involved, but it seems as though the effect is procced upon every damage a character causes by ability to the opposing character

I doubt the mastery actually stacks upon itself, but it is a very large increase on the damage procs caused by damage over time champs

wake me when riot uses a less complicated stacking formula  cuz if it refreshes upon damage, it comes to like 10 procs of 2/3X + 6.66% ap

press it all together and it comes to 6.66 X +  66.66 % ap ratio

that is a very dramatic increase in damage for swain....yet a justified one for his lack of countermeasures against lane swaps and every mage/tank in the game combined with his mediocre waveclear)

but to make it simple, let's say swain has 40 ap at level 6(not generous, not weak), he then does a bonus of 46 damage rounded down, if you factor swain's potential increase of up to 14%(for 3 E at 6), it comes to a grand total of 53 damage

if you take this to the extreme at full build where you will easily have 400 ap, that is 530 extra damage just from a mastery others will likely only gain 100 from, if that, and that's not factoring in other variables like how riot stacks the incoming damage

All these changes look like they're nerfing the symptom rather thant the problem. Broken items/masteries made certain champions OP, so now they're nerfing the champions rather than the items/masteries. And then when those items get nerfed (and they will, I don't think anyone is expecting Guinsoo's to remain as strong as it is now, for example), those champions that got nerfed will be significantly weaker than intended and receive no compensation.

And then there's Rammus, who's only OP right now because everyone and their mother are playing AA based champions.

Came in to post this after seeing the changes. As a Swain main for quite awhile I can say a few things about the champ.

First of all, he can be countered by other mages, or a good Assassin player that knows when to all in. Lux, Syndra, Annie, Brand, Veigar,basically any mage that has serious burst potential can beat Swain in lane. Swain basically NEEDS to land Nevermore or he won't get a kill, as opposed to all of the champs I mentioned above that have a MUCH easier time landing a snare. If you know how to lane against Swain, you know to dodge the snare, and you also know it has a ridiculous long CD (18 seconds at level 1) and it is his last ability to get leveled up. So basically he has it at level 1 for the majority of the game, he can't afford to level it and miss out on his DoT. 

Swain needs to snowball in order to be effective late game. All of Swains damage is DoT, which is useless late game when other champs are dealing out 1500 damage a second on crits and spells if Swain is not already snowballed. No sense being about to do 1500 damage, over 6 seconds....most team fights don't even last that long. Only thing Swain has going for him is his sustain, but again if he's not crazy snowballed, new ADC's and masteries (looking at executioners) can just tear him apart.

I rarely, if ever see Swain being played, so I have no idea what Riot is thinking with this nerf. If anything I thought Swain would get some buffs because of the lack of mana potions; also for the fact he has a hard time CSing considering he has one of the lowest base damages in the game. You basically have to take AD runes to help with his CSing if you are not the best at doing so. Nerfing Swain because Riot fucked up and came out with some OP masteries like Deathfire is classic Riot though; they just always know what's best.

I'll be playing him in the PBE for the next few days and post in PBE, but again....I know Riot won't listen.
